t: A Song of Ascents. Of David.
Lord,*spn my heart is not haughty, Nor*ld my eyes lofty. Neither*ld do I concern myself with great matters, Nor*ld with things too profound for me.
Surely*ln I have calmed and quieted my soul, Like*ld a weaned child with his mother; Like*ld a weaned child is*i my soul within me.
O*ln Israel, hope in the Lord*s From*ld this time forth and forever.
